alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 11:31PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Harnett, Johnston, Lee, Moore, Randolph and Wake. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1131 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Cary, Sanford, Asheboro, Smithfield, Pittsboro, Siler City, North Carolina Zoo, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay- Varina, Clayton, Zebulon, Angier, Goldston, Seagrove, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs and Morrisville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
